The Bethel National Merit Scholarship is available to full - time entering students at Bethel University.  You must be a National Merit Finalist and list Bethel as your first - choice school to be eligible for this award.

Scholarship Title: Howard R. Bowen Scholarship - Grinnell College
Description: The Howard R. Bowen Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Grinnell College.  You must have graduated from an Iowa high school, be a U.S. citizen, and participate in a scholarship examination and an on-campus interview to be considered for this award.

The Excellence in Equine/Agricultural Involvement Scholarship is available to student members of the American Quarter Horse Association.  You must be a high school senior or a student currently enrolled in an accredited college, university, or vocational school and demonstrate characteristics of excellence acquired through your participation in equine or agricultural activities.  You must also have at least a 3.5 GPA to be eligible for this award.

Scholarship Title: Max Christianson Division of Nursing Scholarship
Description: The Max Christianson Division of Nursing Scholarship is open to students at Union College, Nebraska.  You must be majoring in nursing and have a minimum 3.0 GPA.  You must also be a scholarly role model and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award.

The Pioneer Services Scholarship is available to students at Park University.  You must be an active duty or retired military service member, or be a spouse or dependent of an active duty or retired military service member.  You may also be a survivor of a deceased military member, but you must be pursuing a degree and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award.

The AMVETS/University of Phoenix Scholarship is available to students who are members of the active military, veterans or their families.  To be eligible for this award, you must be one of the following: a current member of the active military (including National Guard and Reserves); an honorably discharged veteran; or a spouse or child (under age 21 or full-time student under age 23) of a current member of the active military or honorably discharged veteran.  Additionally, applicants who reside in the U.S. must meet one of the following requirements: be a legal resident of the United States; have been granted permanent residency; have a valid visa that does not prohibit educational studies; have been granted temporary protected status along with approved Notice of Action issued by Citizen Immigration Services and verified through CIS Form g-845; or have been granted asylum along with the approved Notice of Action issued by the Citizen Immigration Services.  Only the first 300 applications will be considered.

The Doris Edwards Miller Endowed Scholarship is open to full-time students at Westminster College in Utah.  You must be a veteran of the U.S. military or be a child of a veteran.  You must also demonstrate strong character and financial need to be eligible for this award.

The Park Foundation Scholarship is available to both male and female full-time students at Tompkins Cortland Community College.  You must be any of these qualifications to be eligible for this award; a single, male student who is the head of the household with dependents; a single, female student who is the head of the household with dependents; or a Vietnam veteran who no longer has access to educational benefits with a minimum GPA of 3.0.

Scholarship Title: GIA Scholarship Fund for U.S. Veterans
Description: The GIA Scholarship Fund for U.S. Veterans is available to students enrolled at the Gemological Institute of America.  You must be enrolled in the eLearning Accredited Jewelry Professional (AJP) diploma program and be a U.S. military veteran to qualify for this award.

The Women in the Trades Scholarship is available to female students who are over the age of 18.  You must be actively pursing a degree in a trade field in order to qualify for this award.  Preference is given to women who are affiliated with the military.

The FSU Military Veteran Scholarship is available to students attending Ferris State University.  You must have served on an active duty status in the U.S. Armed Forces for a minimum of six continuous months, received honorable or uncharacterized separation, and enrolled at FSU within 4 years from separation to be eligible for this award.

Provided By: University of Oklahoma, College of Law
Description: The James W. Cochran Memorial Scholarship is available to students at the University of Oklahoma, College of Law.  You must be a resident of Oklahoma or an honorably discharged veteran or both to be eligible for this award.  Preference will be given to first-year students.

The Military Scholarship Competition is available to full-time undergraduate students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must be working toward a degree in logistics or an equivalent field and have a minimum 2.5 GPA to qualify for this award.  Available only to current or former active duty military personnel and their dependents.  A 400-800 word essay is also required.

The Frederick/Carroll Voiture Locale 155 Nursing Scholarship is available to full-time students at Carroll Community College.  You must be enrolled in the RN program, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate community involvement to qualify for this award.  Preference is given to military veterans.  A narrative of career goals is required.

Scholarship Title: Hispanic Heritage Scholarship - Nova Southeastern University
Description: The Hispanic Heritage Scholarship is available to Hispanic juniors at Nova Southeastern University.  You must be majoring in education and have completed at least 60 credits.  Additionally, you must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be a U.S. citizen.  You must also have at least one parent of Hispanic ancestry and be fluent in Spanish to be eligible for this award.

Scholarship Title: Rixio Medina and Associates Hispanics in Safety Scholarship
Description: The Rixio Medina and Associates Hispanics in Safety Scholarship is available to students pursuing degrees in occupational safety and health or a related field.  You must be bilingual (Spanish - English) to be eligible for this award.  Preference is given to Hispanic students and students at ABET- accredited schools.

The John Montgomery Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at Dickinson College.  You must have excellent grades in a challenging high school curriculum.  You must also have exceptional talent in the performing or studio arts, superior proficiency in two or more foreign languages, high achievement in independent research or writing, or significant leadership on a regional or national level to qualify for this award.

Scholarship Title: Cotchett Science and Mathematics Teacher Education Scholarship
Provided By: California Polytechnic State University at San Luis Obispo - School of Education
Description: The Cotchett Science and Mathematics Teacher Education Scholarship is available to students at California Polytechnic State University at San Luis Obispo, School of Education.  You must have a concentration in science or mathematics to qualify for this award.  Preference is given to students with financial need.

The Clifford DeBaptiste Scholarship is open to social work majors at West Chester University.  You must demonstrate excellence in academic achievement, community leadership initiatives and a commitment to bicultural and bilingual social work practice to be eligible for this award.  Traditional and non-traditional students in the B.S.W. and M.S.W. programs are eligible.

Provided By: University of Texas, San Antonio - General Scholarships
Description: The Tomas Rivera Endowed Scholarship is available to full-time students at the University of Texas at San Antonio who have completed at least 60 semester hours.  You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, be a resident of San Antonio or South Texas, demonstrate financial need, be a first generation college student and be fluent in a language other than English to be considered for this award.

Provided By: University of the Pacific School of Law
Description: The Amy Olson Memorial Scholarship is available to bilingual students at the University of the Pacific McGeorge School of Law.  You must have the desire to work for a government agency or charitable organization.  Preference will be given to students who have gained maturity from having worked full-time for at least six years.

Provided By: Long Island University, College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences
Description: The Irina and Olga Pikovskaya Scholarship is available to P-3 students at Long Island University - Arnold and Marie Schwartz College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences.  Preference is given to single women who are fluent in an Eastern European language and have a dependent child or children

The Elizabeth Smithgall Scholarship is available to at Millersville University.  You must be in the top ten percent of your class, demonstrate financial need, and have a native language other than English to be eligible for this award.

The Presidential Diversity Scholarship is available to first - year and transfer students at Saint Lawrence University.  You must demonstrate commitment to, and appreciation for, racial and ethnic diversity to be considered for this award.
The Broadwell Chinn Award is available to minority students entering Wittenberg University.  You must have a minimum 3.25 GPA to be eligible for this award.
The F. Armstrong Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Cornell College who contribute to campus diversity.

Provided By: Rutgers University, Edward J. Bloustein School
Description: The Diversity Advancement Program Scholarship is open to graduate students at Rutgers University, Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy who are from underrepresented populations.

Scholarship Title: Ralph Johnson Bunche Distinguished Graduate Scholarship
Provided By: Rutgers University, Newark, School of Law
Description: The Ralph Johnson Bunche Distinguished Graduate Scholarship is available to full-time entering students at Rutgers University, School of Law, Newark.  You must have a substantial educational background or demonstrate a cultural disadvantage to be eligible for this award.
The George Washington Carver Scholarship is open to entering freshmen and transfer students at Simpson College who have distinctive and broadly diverse backgrounds.

Scholarship Title: Multicultural Advancement Award of Distinction Scholarship - CMU
Description: The Multicultural Advancement Award of Distinction Scholarship is open to deserving entering freshmen at Central Michigan University.  You must be a minority student to be eligible for this renewable award.

Provided By: University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee - Lubar School of Business
Description: The Alois Bulawa Scholarship is available to Hispanic junior and senior students at the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee.  You must be majoring in business to be eligible for this award.

The Diversity Scholarship is available to entering students at the Adler School of Professional Psychology.  You must demonstrate a commitment to diversity as it relates to your interest in psychology in order to qualify for this award.  Priority is given to applicants who belong to ethnic, racial, religious, cultural, and sexual identity groups that have traditionally been underrepresented populations in the field of psychology.

Scholarship Title: Richard Mintz Summer Associate Diversity Scholarship
Description: The Richard Mintz Summer Associate Diversity Scholarship is available to second-year law students at an accredited law school.  You must come from a diverse background and have demonstrated academic excellence, community involvement and a commitment to diversity to qualify for this award.  Additionally, you must submit a maximum 500 word essay describing a prior work, academic or volunteer experience where your life viewpoint or perspective on a task or problem enhanced the process and result related to that issue.

The Presidential Diversity Scholarship is available to first - year and transfer students at Saint Lawrence University.  You must demonstrate commitment to, and appreciation for, racial and ethnic diversity to be considered for this award.
The Broadwell Chinn Award is available to minority students entering Wittenberg University.  You must have a minimum 3.25 GPA to be eligible for this award.
The F. Armstrong Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Cornell College who contribute to campus diversity.

Scholarship Title: Ralph Johnson Bunche Distinguished Graduate Scholarship
Provided By: Rutgers University, Newark, School of Law
Description: The Ralph Johnson Bunche Distinguished Graduate Scholarship is available to full-time entering students at Rutgers University, School of Law, Newark.  You must have a substantial educational background or demonstrate a cultural disadvantage to be eligible for this award.

Description: The Diversity Advancement Program Scholarship is open to graduate students at Rutgers University, Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy who are from underrepresented populations.
The Walter N. Ridley Scholarship is available to African-American students at the University of Virginia.
The George Washington Carver Scholarship is open to entering freshmen and transfer students at Simpson College who have distinctive and broadly diverse backgrounds.

Scholarship Title: Multicultural Advancement Award of Distinction Scholarship - CMU
Description: The Multicultural Advancement Award of Distinction Scholarship is open to deserving entering freshmen at Central Michigan University.  You must be a minority student to be eligible for this renewable award.

The Jalen Rose Endowed Scholarship is open to entering freshman students at the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor.  Preference is given to students who are Michigan residents, and/or from an inner-city area, and/or from an underrepresented group.  You must demonstrate financial need and academic merit to be eligible for this renewable award.

The Diversity Scholarship is available to entering students at the Adler School of Professional Psychology.  You must demonstrate a commitment to diversity as it relates to your interest in psychology in order to qualify for this award.  Priority is given to applicants who belong to ethnic, racial, religious, cultural, and sexual identity groups that have traditionally been underrepresented populations in the field of psychology.
